intro: Callista heterocarpa, commonly known as the variable-fruit callista, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in a spherical shape, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its fruit is unique, being a type of capsule that splits open to release seeds. Callista heterocarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
